column4: that could be caused by software glitches with the fs or a utility or it could be a bad drive
you can run fsck on the partitions to check them
the devices shouldn't be mounted when you run fsck though
Yeah, fsck didn't work for me. I got "Bad magic number in superblock"
k, did you try the backup blocks?
It suggests  to use e2fsck -b 8193 <device>. I tried that, but didn't get anywhere. Any suggestions?
try 8192 instead
if that doesn't work, not sure
what happened that caused this?
also you sure you entered the device name properly as in /dev/hda1 etc?
I'm not sure what's been causing this. I got an Error 17 in grub the other day. Ran fsck, used it yesterday. Then last night, it frozen and I don't have a partition table!!
ugh, yeah, not sure
there's an FAQ for Edgy about that I think, re error 17
it's on the wiki I think, I don't have the link handy, maybe someone else does
Hmm.. yeah, I think I'm a little passed the error 17. I think I'm in full disk recovery mode.
How does one determine the block numbers, by the way?
basically that -b option is to use the backup boot blocks, if it can't see those, you're out of luck I think
well, there are 'standard' ones, they are determined by how mkfs is run
Figured as much. If it can't it to recognize the blocks, does that mean my whole disk is fucked or just my data?
it means the data mainly, it could be a bad drive, but it's not necessarily so
basically the mapping as to what data is where is fubar
